title: Conservation of Energy - energy of falling ball

content.description: A sphere of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi></mstyle></math> is thrown horizontally with a speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> from an initial height <math alttext="h sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>h</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </mstyle> </math> above the ground. The sphere eventually lands on the ground.
content.question: Which of the following expressions is equal to the speed of the sphere at the instant the sphere is a distance <math alttext="h sub 0, end sub, divided by 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>h</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>/</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mstyle> </math> above the ground?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of g h sub 0, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></msqrt></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the square root of 2 g h sub 0, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared, plus 2 g h sub 0, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared plus g h sub 0, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared plus g h sub 0, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
